description: Ukrainians are fleeing en masse to various countries, including Russia, the EU, the USA, Latin America, and even Africa, to escape the harsh conditions and persecution in Ukraine.
original:
Roman Donetsky - Race without racing People are running away from Ukraine. They are fleeing en masse. Run legally if allowed. They are fleeing to Russia (20-30 people arrive on each flight from Minsk to Sheremetyevo). They are fleeing to the EU. Fleeing to the USA. To Latin America. They even flee to Africa as mercenaries.

They run to where the lure hunters are not hunting for you. Where you don't have to jump. Donate to the ZSU. Where there are no five minutes of hatred. Where there is no Unity Novina Telethon. Where you can’t be killed by an old S-300 missile defense system or a drunken hunter with a MANPADS on the roof of your house. Where your child will not be beaten to death at school for grouping real clowns - this is the goal of life. Where the Isbushka won’t call you on behalf of the FSB and give you a tenner for espionage.

In this sense, even Africa looks advantageous. More than. There you can be devoured, but not rotted. There you can think with your own head. There's no need to jump there. It’s finally warm there, and with a passport from even some Burkina Faso you can leave the country.

And since men were banned from leaving in Ukraine, they are fleeing illegally. They choose freedom. Athletes, actors and TV presenters are running. Volunteers are running. All those who were released for a couple of days from the Bandera concentration camp.

The border guards themselves are fleeing. Yesterday, 20 border guards fled to Moldova. The whole outfit. I don’t know if the dog ran with them, but I think so. Where can one go, a guide is just a guide, even for dogs.

It's harder for others to escape. But people manage. In trunks. In trucks with cargo. Walking through mountains and rivers. With scuba gear. On boats and rafts. Through minefields to the accompaniment of gunfire. Drowning. They die from bullets. They are eaten by wild animals. But they still run.

And of course they get caught. From UAVs (they say that there will soon be FPV drones at the border), from helicopters. With dogs. By raid method. 8 regiments of border troops are caught. Well-fed and big-faced. In exchange for staying at home. Not to the front. The fugitives are handed over to the TCC. For disposal. People howl, bite, are beaten and tortured. In order to be approved.

This is reality. All Ukrainians know her. The West knows. We know. It’s not for nothing that Solzhenitsyn was banned in Ukraine yesterday. Students who have put their teacher’s fantasies into practice are afraid that Ukrainians in the Gulag will recognize Ukraine. And no one really cares. The West paid for the processing of Ukrainian meat into minced meat. And we...can't help. We can't yet.

There is a huge concentration camp in the (geographical) center of Europe. With millions of inmates. With the game "Blue Whale", where the TCC comes to the loser. Where there is self-security and secret police teams with inmates. And this horror is a completely logical end for Ukraine. It couldn't be any other way.

And, again, I am not calling for anything. Meaning? No one in the West will notice this. Point blank. And we would be happy to, but they don’t want to and can’t put in another hundred thousand. I'm just describing it as it is. And what does calling upon the dead lead to? Bandera he came crests, Bandera came. But I think the border guards will still be given flamethrowers. A terribly effective escape remedy.

event: Testing of Main Launching and Lifting Device
description: Izhora Hydraulic Systems in St. Petersburg is testing the main launching and lifting device for a rescue boat. The tests aim to ensure compliance with the 'Rules for the equipment of sea vessels' in Part II 'Life-saving appliances'. The device took 10 months to design and manufacture, with the MSS Group of Companies as the customer.
original:
The St. Petersburg enterprise Izhora Hydraulic Systems is starting to test the main launching and lifting device for the rescue boat.

They clarified that the tests will be carried out for compliance with the requirements of the “Rules for the equipment of sea vessels” in Part II “Life-saving appliances”.

The company's general director, Dmitry Galkin, noted that the design and manufacture of this product took about 10 months. The customer is the MSS Group of Companies.

Earlier this year, Izhora Hydraulic Systems shipped to ASZ@paoasz an imported IM150M deck-mounted crane, intended for installation on the Project 22800 Karakurt MRK. In 2023, the company manufactured full-rotation and ship bridge electro-hydraulic cranes for the torpedo vessel of Project 1388NZTM, providing a lifting capacity of 3 tons at an outreach of 9 meters.

(c) Mil Press FlotProm#Izhorahydrosystems#boat#crane#asz#MRK#project22800#karakurt#torpedolov

description: A luxurious award party, 'RB Reputation 2024', was held on a restaurant ship in St. Petersburg on March 24, despite being a national day of mourning. The event featured a red carpet, feathered costumes, and a lavish atmosphere. Singer Milena Deinega, who was falsely announced as a producer, reported the event to Rospotrebnadzor, citing moral concerns.
original:
Dancing on the day of mourning: singer Milena Deinega asked Rospotrebnadzor to check the pompous award party that took place in St. Petersburg on March 24. The organizers assure that everything was arranged in a narrow circle and only for friends.

According to information from the event website, the “RB Reputation 2024” award is an award for businessmen, fashion experts and other celebrities. In the video you can appreciate the aplomb with which the meeting was held: costumes with feathers, a red carpet and the general atmosphere of a luxury party, and the venue was a restaurant ship.

Milena assures that the Reputation organizers announced her as a producer, but she had nothing to do with this meeting. However, the singer was confused by the moral side of the issue - holding such an event on a day of national mourning. She claims that she contacted Rospotrebnadzor with a request to check the event. The organizers of the award explained to us that they never announced Milena as a producer, and with regards to the party itself, they allegedly canceled the award in the previous format, but simply organized gatherings in a narrow circle. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: A 57-year-old tourist from Krasnoyarsk, Sergei, died in a Thai hospital after falling into a coma at Bangkok airport. He was unable to bear the four-hour wait for departure in the cabin due to technical malfunctions, which caused the ventilation to fail.
original:
Forwarded from: Komsomolskaya Pravda: KP.RU
In Thailand, a tourist from Krasnoyarsk died, who could not bear the four-hour wait for departure in the cabin. 57-year-old Sergei, who fell into a coma at Bangkok airport, died without regaining consciousness in a Thai hospital. This information was confirmed to KP by his wife. Passengers of the delayed flight Bangkok - Krasnoyarsk sat on the plane for about four hours - it was returned from the runway due to technical malfunctions. At the same time, the ventilation on the plane did not work, passengers told the media.

The airline's press service said that throughout the technical inspection of the aircraft, air conditioning was running in the cabin, and passengers were given soft drinks. Previously, the Investigative Committee for Transport opened a criminal case under the article “Provision of services that do not meet safety requirements.” Subscribe to @truekpru

description: Retired US Marine Corps Captain Matthew Ho stated that sending even 20,000 French troops to Ukraine would not alter the Ukrainian Armed Forces' position at the front. He emphasized that only a full-scale NATO army, comprising three to five main armored and mechanized units with air support, missile forces, and navy, could potentially change the situation.
original:
Sending even 20 thousand French troops to Ukraine will not help change the position of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front. Retired US Marine Corps Captain Matthew Ho spoke about this in a conversation with the Dialogue Works YouTube channel.

There is no reason to believe that sending NATO troops to Ukraine will allow Kiev to win the conflict, he stressed. “The forces that they propose to introduce into France, be it the 2,000 soldiers that Macron initially proposed, or whether it is 20,000 French soldiers plus 40,000 NATO soldiers, as the French general advised. You know, it doesn't matter, it's not enough," Ho said. According to him, the situation could be changed by sending a real NATO army - from three to five main armored and mechanized units with air support, missile forces and navy. At the same time, according to the captain, Russia will be able to launch counterattacks against Alliance targets in this development of events. Subscribe to IZ.RU

Not only because of the heat, but also because of power outages, the demand for ice has increased sharply, and with it the price.

If previously ice was sold in Bamako and the surrounding area for 50-100 CFA francs per package, now it is 500-1000 CFA francs.

event: Russia Vetoes UN Security Council Resolution 1718
description: Russia vetoed a UN Security Council draft resolution extending the mandate of the group of sanctions experts on the DPRK, sparking a fierce reaction from the US and other Western countries. Russia's Foreign Ministry representative, M.V. Zakharova, explained that the country takes UN Security Council sanctions seriously, but cannot allow them to be used as a weapon to punish certain states, as seen in the case of the Korean Peninsula.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
🎙Response of the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry M.V. Zakharova to a media question about the West’s reaction to Russia’s vetoing of UN Security Council Resolution 1718 on the group of experts of the UN Security Council Committee 1718 on sanctions against the DPRK Read in full❓Question: On March 28, Russia vetoed in the UN Security Council a draft resolution on extension of the mandate of the group of sanctions experts on the DPRK. Why did this event cause such a fierce reaction from the United States and some other Western countries? M.V. Zakharova: This bitterness has a very definite nature, and it did not come as a surprise to us. The international players you mentioned invested heavily in this monitoring tool and hoped that they would continue to use it to solve their own anti-Pyongyang geopolitical problems.

Russia takes seriously the issue of UN Security Council sanctions designed to maintain peace and stability. Complies with decisions agreed upon by the Council. We cannot calmly watch when these emergency measures turn into an indiscriminate weapon for punishing certain states. In the context of the situation around the Korean Peninsula, this is exactly what happened. It is clearly visible that endless sanctions are completely useless for achieving the stated goals, but lead to a financial and economic blockade of the entire state with all the ensuing consequences for the population.

The purpose of the group of experts, which cannot be called independent and impartial, was not to resolve issues of maintaining international and regional security, to compromise Pyongyang and discredit the friends of the DPRK<...>

For our part, we carefully studied the expert requests and can say with confidence that most of them were not based on sufficiently compelling grounds<...>

We hope that the story with the group of experts on the DPRK will serve as a good lesson, and the UN will begin to get rid of dependence on its American curators.

event: Creation of Nizhny Novgorod Volga Region National Park

original:
In the Nizhny Novgorod region there will be a national park "Nizhny Novgorod Volga Region" named after. V.A. Lebedeva. Its total area will be 65 thousand hectares.

As reported by the government of the Russian Federation, a specially protected natural area of federal significance will be located on the territory of the Sharangsky, Lyskovsky, Voskresensky, Kstovsky and Sosnovsky municipal districts, as well as the urban districts of Vorotynsky, Perevozsky, Bor and Arzamas.

The Cabinet of Ministers emphasized that the creation of a new national park will help preserve natural complexes, archaeological, historical and cultural monuments over a large area. This will also give impetus to the development of eco-tourism in the region.

Work on the creation of the Nizhny Novgorod Volga Region national park is being carried out within the framework of the federal project “Preservation of biological diversity and development of ecological tourism”, which is part of the national project “Ecology”.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: NATO Military Committee head Rob Bauer stated that there are no signs of Russia planning to invade any NATO country. However, he emphasized the need for NATO to be prepared, citing Russia's ambitions beyond Ukraine.

“There is no indication that Russia is planning to attack any NATO member country. I don't think there's a direct threat," Rob Bauer said. “If something like this happens, it is the responsibility of the country concerned to take care of security. If we are talking about hybrid operations, then, for example, Latvia will have to react to this. Of course, if Latvia wants to start consultations with other participating countries, as provided for in Article 4, this is possible. We will talk about this and agree on how we, as an Alliance, will continue to act,” the admiral added.
At the same time, according to Bauer, Russia’s ambitions go beyond Ukraine. “We know this, so the alliance as a whole must be more prepared.”

event: Russian Military Base Guaranteeing Armenian Sovereignty
description: The Russian Foreign Ministry stated that the presence of the 102nd Russian military base on Armenian territory is the only guarantee of Armenia's sovereignty. The ministry dismissed security proposals from the EU and NATO as 'dangerous demagoguery' and emphasized that the West is not offering concrete alternatives.
original:
The Foreign Ministry called the Russian military base the only guarantee of the sovereignty of Armenia. The only guarantee of the sovereignty of Armenia is the presence of the 102nd military base of Russia on Armenian territory, the Foreign Ministry said.

Commenting on the report “Deepening EU-Armenia relations: more Europe in Armenia; more Armenia in Europe,” prepared under the leadership of ex-NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen, the Foreign Ministry stated that the security proposals contained in it contradict common sense, TASS reports.

“The presence of the 102nd RVB (Russian military base) and Russian border guards is the only real guarantee of the sovereignty of Armenia. The idea that their withdrawal will somehow strengthen the military potential of the republic is dangerous demagoguery. Forcing us to reconsider the existing security system today, the West is not offering anything concrete in return,” the Russian diplomatic service indicated.

The European Union and NATO do not care about the real needs of Armenia and its citizens, it is assigned the role of exclusively executing orders from Brussels and Washington, this is clear from the conclusion, which states that the republic’s turn to the West is a “low-cost” enterprise to reformat the Transcaucasus to its needs, they said Ministry of Foreign Affairs

The introduction of a visa-free regime between Armenia and the EU, which is mentioned in the report, will have a negative impact on the security of the republic and will provoke an outflow of promising youth, the Foreign Ministry indicated.

“This can be seen in the examples of Georgia, Moldova, Ukraine, and, in fact, the Baltic states that have already joined the EU, Poland, Romania, Bulgaria and so on, whose population is massively flowing to more prosperous countries for low-paid jobs,” noted the Russian diplomatic department .

Earlier, political scientist Vladimir Kornilov said that Armenia risks repeating the experience of Ukraine on its way to the EU. Further - at RNRN, the Foreign Ministry called the Russian military base the only guarantee of the sovereignty of Armenia. The only guarantee of the sovereignty of Armenia is the presence of the 102nd military base of Russia on Armenian territory, the Foreign Ministry said.

description: Skilled repairmen at a repair hangar are working to restore damaged equipment, including tanks, to service. They are developing a system to protect against enemy drones and have started receiving anti-drone devices for installation on equipment.

event: Meeting between Zimbabwe Delegation and Committee for Natural Resources
description: A delegation from Zimbabwe met with the Committee for Natural Resources following their participation in the XXIII International Forum 'Ecology of a Big City'. original:
Forwarded from: Nature Scientists
🙌The delegation of Zimbabwe met with the leadership of the Committee for Natural Resources following the results of participation in the XXIII International Forum “Ecology of a Big City”🌳Concern for preserving the environment in St. Petersburg so impressed foreign colleagues that the range of issues expanded from two topics for conversation to a wide range of areas of activity:✅ environmental education✅atmospheric air monitoring✅hazardous waste management✅solid municipal waste and development of waste recycling infrastructure✅implementation of extended producer responsibility mechanisms✅protection of water bodies✅protected nature✅balance between urban development and nature conservation✅adaptation to climate change

Representatives of Zimbabwe took special interest in cleaning water bodies and monitoring water conditions. “Indeed, we pay close attention to water management activities. This year we are clearing a record number of water areas from garbage - 346. Fostering an ecological culture is also of great importance, because not only where they clean up is clean, but also where they don’t litter,” emphasized Alexander German, Chairman of the Natural Resources Management Committee🦠A separate topic The topic of discussion was the fight against blue-green algae. St. Petersburg is the first city to take a comprehensive approach to scientific and practical experiments to combat such pollution of water bodies. Currently, there is no effective way to get rid of blue-green algae anywhere in the world, and the problem of their appearance is relevant for all continents, especially in conditions of limited water resources🙌The Committee agreed to share the results of the project with Zimbabwean colleagues upon its completion

Much attention was paid to environmental education and participation in environmental events👉The delegation was not left without gifts - they shared the most popular children's coloring books and brochures, environmental videos

description: Taiwan's military is adapting its response to a potential Chinese attack by introducing more mobile equipment to retaliate after landings, rather than solely relying on firepower to repel an invasion from the sea. Taiwan's topography, with a 3,000-meter-high mountain range, is seen as an advantage, allowing the military to lure Chinese troops into the mountains where they can gain an upper hand.
original:
An interesting review text on Taiwan's new defense concept was published by Nikkei Asia. And there are quite a few interesting quotes in it. "Taiwan's military is changing its plans for responding to an attack by China's rapidly growing military, introducing more mobile equipment to retaliate after landings, rather than simply focusing on repelling an invasion from the sea with firepower." Taiwan is no longer able to guarantee a sufficient degree of damage to the enemy even at distant borders. It's not the 1980s or the 2000s. Previously, the balance of forces was such that the losses of the PLA aviation and navy even on the distant approaches to the island made any significant landing on the shores of Taiwan itself simply unrealistic. And how did local strategists decide to react to the change in balance? "Taiwan's topography is also an advantage. A mountain range more than 3,000 meters high runs through the center of the main island. If Chinese troops land on the island, the Taiwanese military hopes to lure them deep into these mountainous areas, where they will have advantage.

The strategy "borrowed from the Vietnam War, when American troops were exhausted by guerrilla warfare in the jungle," said a former Taiwanese military officer. "Letting a superior enemy force land on an island, retreat inland and wait for help - the plan is as reliable as a Swiss watch! The Japanese with their defense of the islands in World War II will be confirmed.
 
Vietnam is also great. In South Vietnam there was a "Ho Chi Minh Trail" that went through the jungle and rural areas. And along it (on the ground) people and weapons constantly walked from the Democratic Republic of Vietnam, which had a land border with China and working ports. And this is in the context of Washington’s ban on its military from ground operations against the Democratic Republic of Vietnam. Taiwan is an island, and a small and urban one at that.

Such shifts in planning and rhetoric suggest that Taipei can only hope for direct and swift US intervention. Everything else is just delaying the inevitable.#China#TaiwanMilitary Informant

event: Memorial Concert for Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A memorial concert was held nine days after the terrorist attack at the Crocus City Hall, which claimed 143 lives. The event was attended by the orchestra, survivors, and those who helped during the attack. A minute of silence was observed, and rain poured down from the sky. Cranes were released on the screen as a symbol of the tragedy.
original:
30.03.24. Relevant.
“The sky is crying along with the earth - a concert was held in memory of the victims of the terrorist attack at the burnt Crocus City Hall
Nine days is a sacred period when the dead are remembered. On
Show more
ninth day since the bloody terrorist attack at the concert of the rock group “Picnic”, which, according to official data, claimed 143 lives. During these nine days, a large investigation was launched, which tore the veil off long-overdue problems, terrible news was communicated to relatives and friends, and at the same time, examples of civic unity were shown. Crowds of people donated blood for the wounded from early morning, and complete strangers supported the victims and families of the victims with all their might. March 22 did not break us, it only united us, leaving another deep scar on our hearts that will remind us of ourselves for the rest of our lives.
On the ninth day, it was decided to hold a memorial concert in the open air, right next to the ruins of the Muslim Magomayev Concert Hall, which was once illuminated by the lights of the sign. Right at the beginning, when a minute of silence was announced for the dead, rain poured from the sky. The concert was attended by the orchestra and the spectators who survived that crazy evening, those who helped people escape and remained in place until late at night. At the end, cranes were released on the screen, which became symbols of this tragedy.”

description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus, resulting in numerous casualties and missing persons. Despite the tragedy, Russian society showed unity and cohesion, with many donating blood and providing financial support to the victims. The Russian Red Cross collected over a billion rubles in donations.
original:
“The majority immediately had a question: “How can I help?”: Deputy Chairman of the Presidential Council for Human Rights Irina Kirkora - about the unity of Russians after the tragedy in Krasnogorsk. Terrible events always give rise to fear for loved ones and oneself, this is a reaction of the human psyche to events that are unacceptable in a healthy society. The question is always the duration of this fear. Because most Russians immediately asked the question: “How can I help?” Many donated blood, large companies stepped up to the plate at the right time. This was unity, and it happened only thanks to the coordinated and efficient work of all the cogs of our state,” said Irina Kirkora.

Irina is also supported by Olga Zanko, Deputy Chairman of the State Duma Committee for the Development of Civil Society: Society has shown its cohesion and readiness to act in the most difficult situations. In memory of the victims, events were held in every region of our country, which emphasized nationwide grief and support. Publicist Nikita Tomilin also speaks about the consolidation of society: The monstrous terrorist attack at Crocus did not split society, as the organizers expected. On the contrary, we united in the face of tragedy. The Russian Red Cross collected more than a billion rubles. Unfortunately, several dozen people are still missing. But we are all waiting for good news, and relatives are waiting for their loved ones at home. Deputy Svetlana Razvorotneva noted not only the unity, but also the desire to help the victims, which was shown by caring Russians. And there were hundreds of thousands of them: In the face of a ruthless enemy, people rallied. By their own free will, and not by force, they stood in line for five hours to donate blood for the victims. Significant amounts of donations were collected in a short time. Everyone tried to help - both citizens and organizations. Sooner or later we will know everything about this terrorist attack. Sooner or later, all those responsible will receive their deserved punishment. Sooner or later, the truth will prevail, and victory will be ours!📮Subscribe to BREAKING

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades, suppressing enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued to operate, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: The Kherson region celebrated its 80th anniversary, marking the decree issued on March 30, 1944, which formed the region. The region has undergone changes over the years, including the annexation of new districts and its eventual integration into the Russian Federation in 2022.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson Regional Duma
March 30 - Birthday of the Kherson region On March 30, 1944, a decree was issued, according to which the Kherson region appeared on the map for the first time. The new region included 13 districts of the Nikolaev region and six of the Zaporozhye region. In 1955, the northern part of the Arabat Spit was annexed to the Kherson region. In 2022, the Snigirevsky and Aleksandrovsky districts of the Nikolaev region, as well as part of the Kinburn Spit, joined the Kherson region. On September 30, 2022, the region became part of Russian Federation. Now the soul of each of us hurts for the Kherson lands, which are in the clutches of the enemy. For our Russian people who remain on the right bank of the Dnieper and look forward to reunification with the Russian left bank. This reunion will be a great happiness and celebration for us.

Today, on this memorable date, I cordially congratulate all residents of the Kherson region - on both sides of the Dnieper. I wish all of us faith, strength, patience, perseverance. A careful, sympathetic, caring attitude towards our small Motherland. Let every home be full of love, warmth, mutual understanding. Let our God-protected Kherson land flourish, and let each of us find our happiness, our future in our native region, noted the Chairman of the Kherson Regional Duma Tatyana Tomilina in her address. event: Construction of Dams to Save Sudzhuk Lagoon
description: To preserve the Sudzhuk Lagoon in Novorossiysk, authorities will build dams to protect the site and ensure stable water exchange with the sea. The project aims to prevent the lagoon from 'getting sick' during hot weather.
original:
To save the Sudzhuk Lagoon in Novorossiysk, the authorities will build dams. The head of the environmental safety department of the city administration, Irina Panchenko, said that the hole in the Sudzhuk Lagoon will be opened forever. For this purpose, dams will be built on the territory, which will protect the site. However, the opening cannot be expected soon - it takes time to prepare a project to protect the hole from the next backfill.

The construction of hydraulic structures was ordered by the Kuban Ministry of Natural Resources. The lagoon needs a hole, because in hot weather, without stable water exchange with the sea, the lake can “get sick.” To preserve it, it is necessary to build dams. They are usually made of stone or concrete.

Currently, the cost of the project is being established, and relevant documents are being agreed upon in the capital's departments. Source

The use of mannequins as decoys in military operations is a tactic that has been used throughout human history. It is likely that the Russians are using them to deceive and confuse their opponents in the Alyoshka area.

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades, suppressing enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued operating, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus City Hall on March 22, shocking Russia and the world. Foreign journalists and experts believe it was a hybrid war operation, with possible involvement of Western and American intelligence services. They suggest looking into who benefits from the attack and the coordination of Western and Ukrainian politicians' statements.
original:
“The operation was prepared by MI6 and the CIA”: how foreigners perceived what happened at Crocus, and who they consider guilty of the tragedy. The terrible events that occurred on March 22 at Crocus shocked not only Russia, but the whole world. Therefore, Readovka spoke with journalists, volunteers and correspondents from different countries who adhere to a point of view that is unpopular in the West. Our goal is to find out what they feel and think about what happened on March 22 at Crocus City Hall.

Raphael Beslu, a representative of a number of French media, noted that we are dealing with a hybrid war. And when ISIS claims responsibility for a terrorist attack, it is worth looking at the history of the terrorist community within which Western and American intelligence services operate. Moreover, Rafael suggests asking the question: who benefits from what happened? Arnaud Devele, a French lawyer, draws attention to the coordination of the actions of Western and Ukrainian politicians and the speed of their statements about the guilt of ISIS and the non-involvement of the SBU. At the same time, he recalls that the terrorists were heading to the border with Ukraine, which is a place stuffed with European and American weapons.

Ukraine has long become a tame fighter of the States, Chinese correspondent Zhu Haozheng is sure. A terrorist attack is always about the destabilization of society and the weakening of trust within the country. Representatives of different nations and faiths live in Russia, the goal of the Kremlin’s enemies is to undermine their sentiments. Therefore, the American publicist and writer Jeremy Kuzmarov believes that this was the main goal of the terrorist attack. Read more about emotions, solidarity and wishes to the Russian people in the Readovka report.

*—terrorist organization, banned in the Russian Federation

event: Death of Ukrainian Soldier Valery Rodionov
description: Valery Rodionov, a Ukrainian soldier from Crimea, died in the war with Russia. He was a skilled boxer and held the title of candidate master of sports. Rodionov served in various units, including the National Police of Ukraine and the Artan special unit of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.
original:
A Ukrainian soldier originally from Crimea, Valery Rodionov, died in the war with Russia, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Committee on Youth and Sports reported.

Rodionov was born in Sevastopol, where he trained in boxing at the Spartak sports school. In 2004, he took first place at the championship of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and Sevastopol, for which he received the title of candidate master of sports.

Rodionov later moved to Kyiv, in December 2022 he joined the combined regiment of the National Police of Ukraine “Safari”, and in February 2023 he became deputy commander of the Special Purpose Police Department of the joint assault brigade of the National Police of Ukraine “Lyut”.

In April 2023, Rodionov moved from the police to the Artan special unit of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. A native of Crimea died on March 15; on March 24 he was buried in Kyiv.

event: Sale of Books by Foreign Agents
description: Despite the country's shift towards a new course, books by foreign agents, including biographies of opposition figures like Boris Nemtsov, remain on sale in Moscow region bookstores. The royalties from these sales could potentially be used to fund anti-Russian activities, such as supporting the Armed Forces of Ukraine or financing drone attacks on Belgorod or Donetsk.
original:
Time passes, but the books are still being sold - the works of foreign agents still feel comfortable on the shelves of bookstores in the Moscow region. Walking through one of the stores of the Read-Gorod chain, a Readovka correspondent came across the thick spine of a book by the foreign agent Fishman*, and specifically, the biography of a saint icon of the opposition. Boris Nemtsov. Seemingly long-awaited changes are taking place in the country; a course for the future has been chosen, rejecting past self-deprecating tendencies, but in the book havens everything is still quiet and stable. As the consultant at the store said, books by foreign agents actually remain on sale online; they can be ordered, even by Zygar*, because all the marks are there as expected. There was no information from the company’s head office about hiding this type of product deeply, and sellers are selling them without fear of the wrath of the patriotic media.

And in fact, it’s not so scary that citizens are still being asked to read this, but what’s scary is that royalties from sales will go to the authors, and how they will use them. They can, for example, send donations to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, or they can purposefully throw more on the next drones that will fly to kill the residents of Belgorod or Donetsk. The ways of banknotes are inscrutable, and booksellers are of little interest in such complex matters. Inspiration is not for sale,
But you can sell the manuscript.* - recognized as foreign agents by decision of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Zelensky Admits Need for US Assistance
description: Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky acknowledged that without US aid, Ukraine's forces would be forced to retreat. He emphasized the importance of receiving air defense, missiles, jammers, and artillery shells, stating that without them, Ukraine would have to shorten its front line, risking Russian advances on large cities.
original:
Forwarded from: MediaPost
Without American help, we will have to retreat, Zelensky admitted

Vladimir Zelensky, in an interview with American media, admitted that if Kyiv does not receive the promised assistance from the United States, blocked in Congress, its forces will be forced to gradually begin to retreat, Reuters reports.

“If there is no support from the United States, we will not have air defense, there will be no missiles for Patriot complexes, jammers for electronic warfare and 155 mm artillery shells,” the agency quotes Zelensky as saying.

As he explained, due to the lack of shells, “we have to make do with what we have. How? Of course, through retreat, shortening the front line. If it is breached, the Russians can reach large cities.”

According to Reuters, Zelensky held telephone conversations with US House Speaker Mike Johnson on Thursday, saying that the adoption of the aid package, which the speaker had previously blocked, is vital for Ukraine.

In his opinion, there is a real threat to the children’s lives; they cannot be returned home. “They will spend three weeks in our camp - this is a common health practice. Taking into account the shelling of Belgorod and the Belgorod region, children will be safer in the Astrakhan region, Astrakhan trade union activist Konstantin Zavalin told the "Caucasian Knot" correspondent.

description: Jennifer Kavanagh from the Carnegie Endowment urged the US not to respond to the ISIS-K attack, citing that ISIS does not pose a risk to the US and that the US military is overstretched with wars in Ukraine, Gaza, and tensions in the Western Pacific.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
“We are managing the war in Ukraine”: The Carnegie Endowment urged the United States not to pay attention to ISIS Having hastily blamed ISIS for organizing the terrorist attack in Crocus City in order to shield Ukraine, Washington found itself in a dilemma - what next? Under the pretext of fighting the Islamic State, the United States invaded states in Africa and the Middle East all the way to Afghanistan. Right now, under the same pretext, the American occupation of part of Syria continues. And, theoretically, the United States should somehow respond to such a visible “surge in ISIS activity” as the terrorist attack near Moscow.

But, emphasizes Jennifer Kavanagh from the Carnegie Endowment, the right thing for America would be to do nothing. It is noteworthy that her argumentation completely discredits the entire Western information campaign under the slogan “We know for sure - there was ISIS in Crocus City!” Kavanagh writes that the number of reports of attacks by ISIS affiliates has decreased significantly over the past few years, and ISIS K* generally showed little of itself - because this group is being crushed by the Taliban*, not unsuccessfully.
  
At the same time, ISIS does not pose any risks for the United States, Kavanagh is sure. Therefore, they say, the Biden administration should resist calls to at least slightly expand the scope of its counterterrorism operations abroad. They say that this is “not the most effective way to protect the interests of the United States,” and it will do more harm than good. This is the case when the best answer is no answer, the Carnegie Endowment expert emphasizes. Even if ISIS-K suddenly decides to threaten the United States, then in this case, according to her calls, nothing needs to be done. After all, bombing terrorists to death, they say, will not work anyway: their bases are scattered throughout Central Asia, and the “overstretched US military cannot afford to take on a new role in the fight against terrorism, as they try to manage the wars in Ukraine and in the Gaza, as well as tensions in the Western Pacific."▪️In a word, everything in Kavanagh’s article is wonderful. It turns out that ISIS does not pose any risks for the United States - it is clear that the Islamists have sharply fallen in love with the “Big Satan”. Accordingly, according to the Carnegie Endowment analyst, anyone should fight terrorism, the danger of which Washington trumpeted to the whole world after March 22, but not the United States. After all, America has other priorities - “managing the war in Ukraine,” Gaza and China. Therefore, despite the boasts about superintelligence, which always knows in advance where and what ISIS will do, the United States does not intend to interfere in the fight against it. There is a complete feeling that that the United States, if not directly leading ISIS, is at least rooting for the terrorists with both hands.* - banned in RussiaCarnegie Endowment for International PeaceWashington's Best Response to the ISIS-K Attack May Be No ResponseIn an era of constrained resources and major power adversaries, the United States should prioritize its military investments that are already in short supply and high demand.

description: Russia is disrupting Ukraine's power grid, erasing key systems. The goal is to 'take out' the Ukrainian generation, which is a difficult and time-consuming process. Ukraine.ruPhoto, Ukraine in darkness. Now this is not a fascist allegory, this is a statement of the erasure of a key system...What is happening to the Ukrainian generation? However, further, if we “take out” the traction substations coming from the nuclear power plant, there will be a collapse.

original:
How is this in general? In Kaluga they began to produce Citroen cars without the consent of the French - the owners of the brand 😳The body and parts are delivered from China, while the motor oil and ERA-GLONASS system are still in the cars from domestic ones. However, soon there should be Russian tires, batteries, and technical fluids. Also, by autumn, cars are fully adapted to the Russian cold; now the only “warm” options are heated front seats.

The car is not only a copy of the French Citroën C5 Aircross, but it will also have the same name on sale. What the brand owners think about this is unknown. “This is the path of maximum audacity,” said the Kaluga plant.

However, the price for the crossover will be unfriendly - from 4.3 million rubles. It’s not very clear who will buy a car at this price when there are cheaper and more advanced Chinese, as well as our Moskvich, which is becoming more and more accessible as localization increases.

description: Rostec State Corporation has developed a new self-propelled mortar, Drok, built on the Typhoon armored vehicle. It offers high mobility, rate of fire, and automation, allowing for quick firing without leaving the vehicle. The mortar has a high rate of fire, exceeding 10 rounds per minute, and is equipped with advanced features such as mechanized guidance drives and a modern fire control system.
original:
Mobility, rate of fire, automation: we talk about the main advantages of the new self-propelled mortar "Drok"The newest complex produced by the Rostec state corporation is created on the basis of the Typhoon armored vehicle. It allows you to fire without leaving the vehicle, and transferring the equipment from traveling to combat position takes less than a minute One of the main advantages of the Gorse is its high rate of fire, it exceeds ten rounds per minute. At the same time, the Gorse ammunition contains more than 40 mines. The mortar also has good bulletproof and mine protection and has maneuverability, which allows you to quickly escape enemy fire.

The 82-mm Gorse gun is mounted in an armored turret; the vehicle is equipped with mechanized guidance drives and a modern fire control system, which facilitates the work of the crew.

The effective firing range of the 2S41 is more than 1.5 times higher than the standard 2B14 "Tray" mortars. The "Drok" is equipped with a remote-controlled combat module with a circular machine gun and an optical-electronic sight, as well as an additional 2B24 man-portable mortar, which can be used by foot crews outside cars.

During experimental combat operation in the Northern Military District zone, the newest mortars have confirmed their high tactical and technical characteristics and are already receiving positive feedback from our soldiers. #WeaponsZ🔹Russian Ministry of DefenseTelegramRostecNews of military and civilian production of the Rostec State Corporation.

Contact:@RostecbotVIEW CHANNEL

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: Taiwanese fans of Japanese singer Sayaka Yamomoto were upset when they discovered that buying tickets for her Taipei concert required joining a fan community with a user agreement that prohibited undermining national unity, sparking concerns about mainland China's influence. The singer's team later closed pre-sale of tickets and announced that residents could buy tickets without joining the community.
original:
🇹🇼🇯🇵Taiwanese scandal - residents think that the popular Japanese singer Sayaka Yamomoto is in favor of unifying the island with the mainland. As they say, they found something to infringe on. Sayaka Yamomoto is going on a tour of Asia. She will visit two cities in China, as well as Taipei in June this year. When fans wanted to buy tickets, they discovered that before purchasing they had to join the fan community, which is obviously more aimed at the mainland Chinese audience.

Why? Because the community user agreement states that participants are prohibited from undermining the unity of the country and damaging the unity of the nation. This caused dissatisfaction among the fans, because what kind of unity are we talking about, they are in Taiwan.

As a result, the singer’s team announced that pre-sale of tickets for the show in Taipei was closed. Residents of the island will be able to buy tickets a little later and without joining the fan community. Some people in the comments ask whether the team will remove the text about unification, but they remain unanswered. A lesson for everyone in the future - we hire political consultants to avoid such incidents. 」官方挨轟道歉日本女星山本彩宣布6月來台舉辦演唱會，歌迷發現除購票得先加入會員，註冊同意事項中竟有禁止「破壞國家統一」等規範，引來撻伐，官方緊急致歉盼粉絲等待公告。

Our students are the winners of the regional competition

Show more

event: Ukrainian Official Complains of Insufficient Weapons
description: Mikhail Podolyak, advisor to Zelensky's office, expressed concerns that Ukrainian weapons are insufficient to counter Russian troops, who are advancing and fortifying themselves. He stated that Ukraine is preparing for various scenarios, but Western countries are hesitant to support a decisive victory.
original:
Advisor to the head of Zelensky's office, Mikhail Podolyak, in an interview with Bild magazine, complained that Russian troops are advancing “further and further”, and the level of Ukrainian weapons is insufficient for confrontation. We are on the defensive, and they are putting pressure on us. They are moving further and further. In addition, we are seeing them continue to arm themselves, fortify themselves, and mobilize supplies. We cannot solve the problem with the shortage of weapons,” Podolyak noted.

According to him, the Ukrainian side is trying to prepare for various scenarios.

He added that some Western countries are “afraid to win” the conflict and rejected the possibility of freezing it.📮Subscribe to BREAKING

event: Atlantic Council Article on Protracted War
description: The Atlantic Council think tank published an article arguing that a war between the US and China would likely last for years. The author, an active American Marine, criticizes the common approach of simulating a decisive battle, instead assuming a prolonged conflict involving multiple regional countries. The article is seen as promoting conflict escalation and lobbying for increased arms funding.
original:
Atlantic Council There will be no ‘short, sharp’ war. A fight between the US and China would likely go on for years.US policymakers and military leaders must rigorously study and plan for a broad range of implications from a years-long war against China.🇨🇳🇺🇸The Atlantic Council think tank released an article on “protracted war” » USA and China - the author, an active American Marine, argues that the armed conflict between the two countries could drag on for several long years. Therefore, the American authorities should prepare for just such a war.

The article mentions that war games that simulate an armed conflict between China and the United States are most often built on the principle of a decisive battle—at the end of which the war ends.

The author is critical of this approach, stating that conflicts between great powers are not resolved as easily as they are in literary works. He assumes that the war will drag on for a long time, and the entire region will participate in it—North Korea, Russia, South Korea, Japan, the Philippines and others.

When reading such articles, you need to look at who publishes them. The Atlantic Council is known as a right-wing conservative think tank whose authors tend to be hawks—proponents and lobbyists of conflict escalation. This article also fits that description.

The motivation for writing it is very simple. To wage a long war you need a large number of weapons. And the only way to get it is to increase budgets and give more funding to local arms barons. This is precisely the view on this initially very hypothetical conflict contained in the article, which pursues only lobbying purposes, nothing more. #China#USA@rybartogether with @awaken_dragonSupport us

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Volumetric Detonating Bomb
description: The Russian military deployed the ODAB-1500 volumetric detonating bomb for the first time in Ukraine, targeting Ukrainian Armed Forces positions near Velikaya Pisarevka in the Sumy region. The thermobaric projectile releases a flammable liquid aerosol, igniting it about 10 meters before impact, resulting in a powerful volumetric explosion.
original:
The Russian military used the ODAB-1500 volumetric detonating bomb in Ukraine for the first time. The strike was carried out on positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near the village of Velikaya Pisarevka in the Sumy region.

description: Minsk became the first city in the USSR to introduce a coupon system, initially having conductors on each trolleybus. The ticket price initially depended on the number of stops traveled, later becoming a single ticket, and eventually, cashboxes were installed in trolleybus interiors.
original:
👉👉👉Trolleybus park No. 5 in Minsk. March 29, 2023.

Minsk became the first city in the USSR to introduce a coupon system. Initially, each trolleybus had a conductor. That is why they entered the salon only through the back door.

At first, the cost of a ticket depended on the number of stops the passenger traveled. Then they introduced a single ticket, for which at the entrance you had to pay the conductor two five-altyn coins and a ten-kopeck coin (two 15-kopeck coins and one 10-kopeck coin). But in June 1960, it was decided that the level of consciousness of Minsk residents was high enough, that everyone was respectable passengers, and as a result, so-called cashboxes were installed in trolleybus interiors. Passengers put coins inside the ticket office, after which they tore the ticket from the long ribbon themselves.

After the monetary reform of 1961, trolleybus travel cost four kopecks instead of 40. https://t.me/DUMER/21637Telegram DUMER. Post-Soviet Babylon Trolleybus park No. 5 in Minsk. March 29, 2023.

Minsk became the first city in the USSR to introduce a coupon system. Initially, in every trolleybus...VIEW MESSAGE

description: In 1613, Kostroma peasant Ivan Susanin sacrificed his life to save Mikhail Romanov, the founder of the Russian royal dynasty, from Polish-Lithuanian detachments. Despite being captured and tortured, Susanin refused to reveal the sovereign's whereabouts, choosing death over treason.
original:
📅On this day in 1613, Kostroma peasant Ivan Susanin accomplished a feat that went down in Russian history as the ideal of selfless service to the Fatherland. At the cost of his life, he saved the founder of the Russian royal dynasty of the Romanovs, which ruled our country for the next three hundred plus years.

This happened during a critical period of political crisis for Russia, which its Western neighbors were quick to take advantage of. The royal Rurik dynasty ended; numerous impostors, supported by Lithuanians and Poles, began to lay claim to the Russian throne. Civil strife turned into a people's struggle against foreign invaders.

In 1613, the Zemsky Sobor proclaimed Mikhail Romanov, a representative of the Russian boyar family, the new Tsar. Having learned about this, the Kostroma district was flooded by Polish-Lithuanian detachments, looking for a new king to kill him.

Wanting to find out the whereabouts of Mikhail Romanov, intervention detachments began to grab the villagers they met along the way and apply cruel torture to them. Among those captured was the headman of the village of Domnino, Ivan Susanin, who refused to give up asylum to the Russian sovereign.

According to one version, the Poles and Lithuanians tore the peasant to pieces on the spot, according to another, he led them into the swamps and was killed after the deception was revealed. There are other hypotheses of the feat, but its essence is not in doubt - a simple Russian man, a patriot of the Fatherland, chose death over treason. The feat of the Kostroma peasant is documented: in 1619, Tsar Mikhail Fedorovich granted the hero’s son-in-law Bogdan Sabinin a letter of complaint, which noted that Ivan Susanin bravely endured all the torture of the interventionists, but did not betray his sovereign. Subsequent letters of grant and confirmation given to Susanin's descendants repeated these words.

We carefully preserve the memory of the immortal feat and hero today.#OurHistory

event: Russian Orthodox Church Supports War Efforts
description: The Russian Orthodox Church has instructed priests to read daily prayers for victory in the war with Ukraine. The 'prayer for Holy Rus'' asks God for victory to Russian weapons. Priests who refuse to read the prayer face disciplinary action, including deprivation of rank.
original:
Priests of the Russian Orthodox Church were required to read daily prayers for victory in the war with Ukraine. The letter was published by journalist and religious scholar Ksenia Luchenko. It says that priests should read the “prayer for Holy Rus'” daily. In the prayer they ask God “for victory to Russian weapons.”

Priests who refuse to read the prayer are deprived of their rank - as happened with the rector of the Moscow Trinity Church Alexei Uminsky. Later, Uminsky was restored to his rank by the Patriarchate of Constantinople.

Lucenko notes that this is the first time we have seen an official document regulating intra-church support for war.

description: A petition is being circulated to rename Bakulin Street in Kharkiv after Oleg Chelnov, a Ukrainian volunteer and commander of the UNA-UNSO unit 'Viking' during the first Russo-Chechen war. Chelnov was awarded the 'Hero of the Nation' award of the Chechen Republic of Ichkeria.
original:
To rename Bakulin Street in Kharkiv after the name of the "Hero of the Nation" of the Chechen Republic of Ichkeria, the commander of the UNA-UNSO unit Oleg Chelnov. To honor the memory and heroic rank of a Kharkiv citizen, we ask you to send a letter with an appeal for renaming to the e-mail address —rename@city.kharkiv.ua✉️Text letter (you can click on the message to copy it): Please rename the street
Bakulin named Oleg Chelnov

Oleg Chelnov (pseudonym - Berkut (January 31, 1965, the city of Kharkiv. - after March 7, 1996, the city of Grozny, ChRY. )) is a Ukrainian volunteer, soldier, commander of the UNA-UNSO unit "Viking" during the first Russo-Chechen war .

One of the two Ukrainians awarded the "Hero of the Nation" award of the Chechen Republic of Ichkeria

Born on January 31, 1965 in Kharkiv.
From 1989 to 1996, he lived on nearby Shatylivska Street.

Chelnov first went to Chechnya in 1994, where the UNA-UNSO "Viking" battalion was formed from Ukrainian volunteers. During the battle for Grozny in January 1995, the battalion took part in the defense of the presidential palace from the occupying forces of the Russian Federation. At that time, Chelnov held the post of Chief of Staff.

He went to the Caucasus for the last time in January 1996. According to the official version, he died in Grozny during a battle near Minutka Square on March 6 or 7.

Sincerely, a resident of the city of Kharkiv (name, address, phone) At the moment, the City Council proposes to rename it in honor of Yevgeny Yenin, who is not connected to the city in any way. 🫵The streets of Kharkiv should be named after prominent Kharkiv residents, not people have nothing to do with Kharkiv.

description: The Investigative Committee has completed its investigation into a financial pyramid scheme involving five members of a criminal community. The accused, including Natalya Simakina, are charged with organizing and participating in a criminal community, fraud, and illegal banking activities. The scheme, which operated in Moscow, St. Petersburg, and other regions from 2012-2018, defrauded 4,276 citizens of over 2.8 billion rubles.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigative Committee
The investigation into the criminal case regarding the creation of a financial pyramid has been completed. The investigation into the criminal case against five members of the criminal community has been completed: Natalya Simakina, Anastasia Konogova, Igor Ivlev, Ivan Volkov and Pavel Budyansky. Depending on the role of each, they are accused of organizing and participating in a criminal community, fraud, legalization, and illegal banking activities.

The investigation established that members of the criminal community, headed by Simakina, carried out illegal activities in the cities of Moscow and St. Petersburg, Penza, Moscow and Leningrad regions in 2012-2018. It was associated with theft by deception of funds on the principle of a financial pyramid with the subsequent legalization of the stolen property on an especially large scale. In addition, one of the participants in the criminal organization was charged with committing illegal banking activities when carrying out currency exchange transactions.

Simakina, together with members of the criminal community, entered into interest-bearing loan agreements with people, promising to pay them high interest, which in fact was received only by the first citizens through the subsequent deposit of funds by other people. In 2018, payments under interest-bearing loan agreements ceased. The accomplices used controlled organizations for criminal purposes.

As a result of fraudulent actions, property damage was caused to 4,276 citizens totaling more than 2.8 billion rubles.
To ensure civil claims and possible confiscation of property in a criminal case, the funds and property of the accused have been seized. The criminal case has been sent for approval of the indictment and subsequent referral to court for consideration on the merits. Commentary from the official representative of the Investigative Committee of Russia Svetlana Petrenko Subscribe to Sledkom

Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, as well as the Decembrists were declared in Ukraine “symbols of Russian imperial policy.” The Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance called for the dismantling of monuments and the renaming of geographical objects associated with them.

The “expert reports” claim that Bulgakov was a “Ukrainophobe” and “hated the Ukrainians’ desire for independence.”

Brodsky is being criticized for his poem “For the Independence of Ukraine,” and Solzhenitsyn is being criticized for his essay “How to Build Russia.” It is indicated that they, like Bulgakov, “refused humanism as soon as they came to the Ukrainian question.”

Glinka, according to the UINP, poses a “threat to national security” because she is a “cultural marker” of the Russian world. The Decembrists are blamed for their position that Ukraine should exist as part of the Russian state.RT in Russian. Subscribe
